name: Palazzo Pubblico
excerpt: The neo-Gothic Palazzo Pubblico overlooks Piazza della Libertà and is San Marino's official seat of government. Visitors can watch a small video about the…
detail_description: The neo-Gothic Palazzo Pubblico overlooks Piazza della Libertà and is San Marino's official seat of government. Visitors can watch a small video about the history of San Marino, visit the ornate Hall of the Council and peek into the presidential waiting lounge, where citizens can book a meeting with the president. Look out for Ronald Cardinali, an English-speaking fortress guard who happily explains everything you're looking at.

name: Torre Guaita
excerpt: The oldest and largest of San Marino's castles, Torre Guaita dates from the 11th century. It was still being used as a prison as recently as 1975.
detail_description: The oldest and largest of San Marino's castles, Torre Guaita dates from the 11th century. It was still being used as a prison as recently as 1975.

name: Changing of the Guard
excerpt: One of Città di San Marino's summer highlights is the changing of the guard in Piazza della Libertà, which takes place several times daily between late…
detail_description: One of Città di San Marino's summer highlights is the changing of the guard in Piazza della Libertà, which takes place several times daily between late June and mid-September.

name: Museo di Stato
excerpt: San Marino's best museum by far is the well laid out if disjointed state museum, which displays art, history, furniture and cultural objects.
detail_description:
San Marino's best museum by far is the well laid out if disjointed state museum, which displays art, history, furniture and cultural objects.
Don't miss the Domagnano Treasure, an Ostrogothic trove of jewels dating back to the 5th and 6th centuries.

name: Torre Cesta
excerpt: Dominating the skyline and offering superb views towards Rimini and the coast, the Cesta castle dates from the 13th century and sits atop 750m Monte…
detail_description: Dominating the skyline and offering superb views towards Rimini and the coast, the Cesta castle dates from the 13th century and sits atop 750m Monte Titano. Today you can walk its ramparts and peep into its four-room museum devoted to medieval armaments.
